verbose_text: This is further supported by a cross-sectional study performing 18 F-fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography (FDG-PET) in 91 RA patients to directly assess vascular inflammation, in which for patients with active RA, anti-CCP levels> = 60 units were positively associated with higher aortic uptake compared with those with lower CCP levels [XREF_BIBR].
